lines.text:
[to woman on witness stand]
Ah... you *assumed*. My dear, you should never *assume*. You see, when you *assume*
[writes the word "assume" on a blackboard]
, you make an *ass*... out of *you*... and *me*.
You want brown juice or green juice?
What's the difference?
Three weeks.
[Oscar's girlfriend is trying to get him to lose weight]
Honey, that's fun fat. Everybody has that.
I don't.
You don't have any fun either.
[repeated line]
Oh, Oscar, Oscar, Oscar!
What are you doing?
Sterilizing the wound.
With beer?
It's got alcohol in it.
You ruined my wine.
Here's a dollar. Buy another three bottles.
What do you dream about?
Living alone.
[pointing under the bed]
There are things growing under there!
[repeated line]
Don't call me Howie!
She likes... David Cassidy better than me!
[Despondent that his daughter, Edna, isn't speaking to him]
So do I!
[repeated line]

[to Oscar]
Let this be on your head.
[Opening narration]

On November 13, Felix Unger was asked to remove himself from his place of residence; that request came from his wife. Deep down, he knew she was right, but he also knew that some day he would return to her. With nowhere else to go, he appeared at the home of his friend, Oscar Madison. Several years earlier, Madison's wife had thrown HIM out, requesting that HE never return. Can two divorced men share an apartment without driving each other crazy?
Everything you've ever owned is on that bed.
[when Oscar opens a suitcase from his closet, clothes fall out]
What's that?
Guess I forgot to unpack from the last trip.
The man puts his ketchup on his salad.
So? I like ketchup. It's like tomato wine.
Everyone thinks I'm a hypochondriac. It makes me sick.
I'm going to the studio to pick up the gauntlet he threw down.
You're so tidy.
Don't talk to me about Christmas, will ya? All that sticky, phony goodwill. I'd like to get a giant candy cane and beat the wings off a sugar plum fairy.

[pointing to Oscar]
Either he leaves or I leave.

[turning to Oscar]
Leave!
[Oscar is dating the princess of a tiny European country]
My country is so small we only sent one athlete to the Olympics.
Oh? What event did he compete in?
All of them!
How did he do?
He died in the relays.

[while doing a commercial]
I am a dramatization of a doctor.
Felix, if you get on that plane alone, I will break every bone in your body.

[repeated line, in an irritated tone]
*Felix*...
